ChunkStoreAPI

Exposes the Storage API for the retrieval and storage of Chunks.  Note that you do not need to make one yourself. You can get the current ChunkStoreAPI instance by referring to the chunk_store_api in your PIPE instance:

let mut th = Pipe::new(&seed, ...);
th.chunk_store_api.do_your_thing();
See Also

Pipe

Functions
get_chunks_by_tag

Get a list of chunks by tag. Return an error if something goes wrong.

Example
let chunk_1_tag = &[10, 39, 210, 19, 304, 29, 210];
let retrieved_chunk = th.chunk_store_api.get_chunks_by_tag(&chunk_1_tag).await.unwrap();
has_tag

Returns true if a tag exists within the network.  Note that when you get false, it doesn't mean the chunk doesn't exist - it could also be the node hosting the chunk isn't online at the moment.

Example
let chunk_1_tag = &[10, 39, 210, 19, 304, 29, 210];
let has_tag = th.chunk_store_api.has_tag(&chunk_1_tag).await;
store_chunk

Stores a chunk in the network. Returns an error if something goes wrong/

Example
let chunk_1_tag = &[10, 39, 210, 19, 304, 29, 210];
th.chunk_store_api.store_chunk(&chunk_1_tag).await.unwrap();
